materials.title: saa
materials.content: Similarly in life, we first bootstrap ourselves via imitation learning (school), which is very reasonable. But even after I graduated school, I had a habit of studying how other people found success and trying to imitate them. Sometimes it worked, but eventually I realized that I would never surpass the full ability of someone else because they were playing to their strengths which I didn’t have. It could be anything from a researcher doing yolo runs more successfully than me because they built the codebase themselves and I didn’t, or a non-AI example would be a soccer player keeping ball possession by leveraging strength that I didn’t have.

analysis.translation: 类似地在生活中，我们首先通过模仿学习（学校）来自我引导，这是非常合理的。但即使在我毕业后，我也有一个习惯，研究其他人如何找到成功并试图模仿他们。有时它奏效了，但最终我意识到我永远不会超越别人的全部能力，因为他们是在发挥他们的优势，而这些优势我没有。它可以是任何事情，从一位研究人员比我更成功地做yolo运行，因为他们自己构建了代码库而我没有，或者一个非AI的例子会是一位足球运动员通过利用我没有的力量来保持控球。
